column1: Denis Suárez Fernández (Spanish pronunciation: [ˈdenis ˈswaɾeθ feɾˈnandeθ]; born 6 January 1994) is a Spanish professional footballer who plays as a midfielder for Celta de Vigo.

column4: Suárez played youth football in his home country for Porriño Industrial and Celta de Vigo.

column1: Suárez signed for Manchester City on 23 May 2011. Manchester City beat off interest from Barcelona
column2: Chelsea and rivals Manchester United signing him for an initial fee of £900
column3: 000.Suárez played in the 2011–12 pre-season friendly match against Los Angeles Galaxy
column4: replacing Edin Džeko in 88th minute. He also converted a penalty in the penalty shootout in the same game. He was an unused substitute in the League Cup game against Birmingham City. In the next round of the League Cup
column5: he made his competitive debut for the club when he replaced Samir Nasri in the 67th minute in the 5–2 win against Wolverhampton Wanderers. On 17 May 2012
column6: Suárez starred for Manchester City reserves against Manchester United reserves in Manchester Senior Cup
column8: he was awarded Manchester City's Young Player of the Year as voted for by the fans.

column1: On 22 August 2013 Suárez completed a transfer to Barcelona for an undisclosed fee
column2: signing a four-year contract. During the 2013–14 season he played mostly for Barcelona B in the Spanish Segunda División to continue his development.

Suárez was loaned to Sevilla for two seasons as part of the deal which saw Ivan Rakitić move to Barcelona. He made his competitive debut on 12 August in the 2014 UEFA Super Cup at Cardiff City Stadium
column3: playing 78 minutes before being substituted for José Antonio Reyes in the 2–0 defeat to Real Madrid. On 11 December
column4: he scored the only goal of Sevilla's final Europa League group match against HNK Rijeka
column5: sending the club through at the expense of their Croatian opponents.

column2: Suárez completed a transfer to Villarreal for an undisclosed fee
column3: signing a four-year contract which includes a buy back clause.

column2: Barcelona announced the return of Suárez after exercising the buy back clause. Barcelona paid €3.5 million and Suárez signed a four-year contract
column3: with an option of a further year depending on the number of appearances. In his first season
column4: Suárez managed only 12 La Liga starts.

column2: Arsenal signed Suárez on loan until the end of the 2018–19 season.

column1: On 30 June 2019 Suárez signed a four-year deal to return to Celta Vigo
Suárez has been capped by Spain U17 and has scored two goals for the team
column2: against Moldova and Northern Ireland. He was also a member of the Spain U19 which won the 2012 Under-19 European Championship.  Suárez was a 71st-minute substitute in the final against Greece and made six appearances at the Championships
column3: scoring twice and playing 284 minutes.On 29 May 2016
column4: he made his senior debut coming on as second-half substitute for David Silva in a friendly match against Bosnia and Herzegovina. A week earlier on 20 May
column5: he had represented Galicia in the region's first match for eight years
